ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I continued learning German in this course after I began the language first semester. I learned new sentence structures that allows me to speak and write longer sentences.

I felt that I did not significantly grow this semester in German in comparison to the 110 course I took last semester. Time spent in class felt much less useful, and the amount of English spoken by all individuals was significantly higher than in the first semester. That said, I do have a relative understanding of the grammatical structures covered this semester. The final test felt extremely disconnected from the course content though, and I have a hard time recalling what was covered in the chapter we were supposed to be covering during that period of time.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I really appreciated the opportunity to take this course, and the range of activities made the learning overall very engaging.
Did well at giving as much immersion, intense grading though

Strengths- thorough, challenging, speaking in german every day, and having asynchronous on Wednesdays.
Weaknesses- the asynchronous assignments sometimes took up to two hours

Gabrielle was very accommodating and helpful, particularly during the later part of the semester. I felt that the semester could have been significantly improved had she insisted that we use German at all times and followed through in explaining new concepts in German. We used the boards in the room significantly less than in prior semesters and, with the primary medium of presenting content being Google Slides, the wait time was consistently insufficient for students to internalize new content and grammatical structures.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, I would. Learning from the grad student is a good experience because she challenges us but is also understanding when we make mistakes. It is a positive language learning environment.
I would highly recommend that other students make every attempt to take 110 and 120 with a faculty member that has lots of experience in teaching new language learners
